--- title: "Skill Gap Analysis" subtitle: "Group 13 Skill Assessments" author: - name: Anu Sharma, Cindy Guzman, Gavin Boss affiliations: - id: bu name: Boston University city: Boston state: MA bibliography: references.bib csl: csl/econometrica.csl format: html: toc: true number-sections: true df-print: paged --- # Team Dataframe Our team conducted an overview of our current technical skills when it comes to Business Analytics and our skill levels. The goal was to understand where the group's strengths and weaknesses were, and understand how the data that was collected could relate to the data that was observed in the research conducted. This was used to identify strengths and weaknesses for the group while also identifying potential gaps within the group. ::: {#c909a607 .cell execution_count=1} ``` {.python .cell-code} import pandas as pd # Extended skills data skills_data = { "Name": ["Anu", "Cindy", "Gavin"], "Python": [5, 3, 4], "SQL": [4, 2, 5], "Machine Learning": [3, 1, 4], "Cloud Computing": [2, 2, 3], "Excel": [5, 4, 5], "Tableau": [4, 3, 4], "Power BI": [3, 2, 4], "R": [3, 1, 4] } # Create DataFrame and set index df_skills = pd.DataFrame(skills_data).set_index("Name") # Ensure all columns are numeric df_skills = df_skills.apply(pd.to_numeric) # Add average skill score across all tools df_skills["Average_Skill"] = df_skills.mean(axis=1) df_skills ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=1} ```{=html}
Python SQL Machine Learning Cloud Computing Excel Tableau Power BI R Average_Skill
Name
Anu 5 4 3 2 5 4 3 3 3.625
Cindy 3 2 1 2 4 3 2 1 2.250
Gavin 4 5 4 3 5 4 4 4 4.125
``` ::: ::: ::: {#42ec3c23 .cell execution_count=2} ``` {.python .cell-code} import seaborn as sns import matplotlib.pyplot as plt plt.figure(figsize=(12, 10)) sns.heatmap(df_skills, annot=True, cmap="coolwarm", linewidths=0.5) plt.title("Team Skill Levels Heatmap") plt.show() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ![](skill_gap_analysis_files/figure-html/cell-3-output-1.png){} ::: :::
